intro: Paris debeauxii, commonly known as the Beauxii mouse-ear, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its small, white flowers and finely divided leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in cool, moist environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range. Its botanical features make it an important subject for ecological and conservation studies.
